This problem was caused by a race condition that happened between selectionChanged and PreferencesChanged callbacks. Since nowadays a SelectionChanged callback does not trigger a refresh of non-visible elements (see bug 356344), the problem should not happen anymore

The problem is still present and could also cause another problem (also reported in bug 346684) where elements and all their children become disabled. There seems to be some problems with the way we handle the preferecnesChanged callback in ReviewNavigatorView.
Re-opened and set severity to major as this can cause whole review groups to be disabled without the possibility of restoring them completely.
